title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 344/94 of 15 February 1994 opening, for the 1993/94 wine year, distillation of table wine as provided for in Article 41 of Council Regulation (EEC) No 822/87
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 344/94 of 15 February 1994 opening, for the 1993/94 wine year, distillation of table wine as provided for in Article 41 of Council Regulation (EEC) No 822/87
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Distillation under Article 41 (1) of Regulation (EEC) No 822/87 is hereby opened for the 1993/94 wine year for all table wine up to a maximum of 3 000 000 hectolitres obtained from grapes grown in the production regions as indicated in

of Commission Regulation (EEC) No 441/88 in which compulsory distillation has been opened for the 1993/94 wine year.
This quantity is allocated by region as defined in Article 4 (2) of Regulation (EEC) No 441/88, as follows:
- Region 1: -,
- Region 3: 400 000 hectolitres,
- Region 4: 1 800 000 hectolitres,
- Region 5: 400 000 hectolitres,
- Region 6: 400 000 hectolitres,
- Region 7: -.

1. The total quantity of table wine for which each producer may conclude one or more contacts may not exceed 20 hectolitres per hectare of area used for the production of table wine. For Spain this quantity is limited at 4 hectolitres per  hectare.
2. Member States may restrict the number of contracts a producer may sign for the distillation operation concerned.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
